column1: Pattern
column2: Examples (comma sep list of ticket Ids)

column1: Hermes answers are just a filler to meet SLAs, do not add value and generates customer frustation
AI resolution is high because customer give up ticket is maked as closed and counts towards AI resolution
Support agents are not checking past similar tickets where customer already provided information they are asking for or did the same troubleshooting steps
Customer get's locked in an "AI Wall" and can't get past it to actually have their problem solved
Ai is requesting same information  customer has already provided within the ticket -  "Ai looped requests"

Ticket automation malfunctioning  - BU reported issues are stuck in CS for weeks (3 weeks inthe example).  While CE requests BU to create a ticket for issue BU discovered and was able to reproduce with all the steps.
After customer provided all the information (logs, screenshots etc) - Hermes keeps sending updates support team is analyzing those files while noone is
Tickets being closed  after 7 days of no customer response while customer is waiting for information we promissed but never sent
Feedback on shared patch (which does not fix the problem) was not processed between CS in direction to CE
Chat conversations are closed prematuraly
Ai (Atlas/Hermes) provides wrong information or does not understand the problem described by the customer
With multiple issue reported in single ticket,  other issues are ignored
Slow Ai/agent resposnes with gaps measured in days
Ai is promissing "something" to be sent or done while it does not send or provide anything
Customer is expressing frustation with support (AI or Agent) responses (quality)
AI/ATLAS responds to SEV1/P1 outages with generic troubleshooting (browser extensions, firewall, cache clearing) instead of immediate engineering escalation

Support consistently begins with customer environment investigation (firewall, VPN, network, browser) before platform-side analysis, causing 1-4 day delays even when issue recurs or affects multiple environments

SEV1/P1 platform issues spend multiple days in standard support troubleshooting (environment checks, generic AI responses) before being escalated to engineering; engineering involvement delayed 1-4 days from initial report

Support does not recognize recurring issue patterns across multiple tickets; each occurrence is treated as isolated/new rather than escalated as systemic pattern with full historical context, resulting in repeated troubleshooting cycles
